p: To examine the effects of CHP and CHL on high glucose-induced intracellular ROS, this experiment was investigated by treating cells with 100 mM glucose alone or combined with different concentrations of CHP (1, 5 and 10 µg/mL) and CHL (1, 5, 10 and 25 µg/mL). The dose-response curve of CH extracts was obtained by isovolumetric additions of CHP and CHL solutions of different concentrations so that the DMSO concentration range was from 0.001 to 0.025% ( v/ v). We found that both CHP and CHL at 1 µg/mL could significantly reduce the percentage of high glucose-induced intracellular ROS ( Figure 6a,b). However, to clarify the effect of DMSO in CH extracts on intracellular ROS accumulation, cells were treated with 0.001 to 0.025% ( v/ v) DMSO alone for 24 h. In the H 2DCFDA assay, we show that the increasing DMSO alone did not affect ROS generation in SH-SY5Y cells ( Figure 6c). This result clarified that both CHP and CHL extracts appeared to be effective reducing the intracellular ROS accumulation at the concentration of 1 µg/mL but not at higher concentrations was not caused by DMSO.
